comment: I took him for 4120 and he was pretty cool but this semester was awful. He rants a lot and preaches his political views the whole class. Doesn't grade anything in a remotely timely manner and isn't a big fan of helping students. Definitely don't recommend him for 4199. Take Wermert.
He is funny. If you go to class every day, you should be fine.

I wish all of the professors at Kennesaw were like him!!! He is hilarious and very knowledgeable! Don't worry if you don't do great on the tests because you can still get an A or a B if you do well on the project and attendance. I would definitely take him again!
Great Professor! He's a fanatic about professionalism so only take his class if you plan to actually act like a professional.

Loved this class. He's hilarious. Go to class, there is a participation grade. Follow directions for assignments. No tests. No final. I'd definitely take him again if I wasn't graduating. Only problem is he never lets you know what you got on your assignments until the last day of class, kind of frustrating.
Easy class. If you do the assignments like the syllabus says you'll do well. No tests, no final. H'e s hoot too. I'd love to take him again if I wasn't graduating!

I took him for MGT 4120-Venture Mgt - I enjoyed him.  I would take him over again in the future.  His tests are surprisingly tough, but are just off his PP slides and the book. There is a big group project that I felt had little structure.  He used his real life work experience as backing for his lectures.  I have/will recommend him to others.

Overall the class was easy. However don't expect to be able to get in touch with him after hours. His syllabus says he can be reached by appointment only but good luck trying to get him to respond. If I had to take him over again I wouldn't. Need more real world business application and not war stories.
Take him for maymester. No tests, 2 assignments, 1 group presentation. Totally worth going everyday for 5 hours a day for 2 weeks.

This class is so much more than just learning the book.  Some of the best lectures I have ever had in college.  He has a strong personality but don't drop the course you will love the guy by the time it's over.

I ended up dropping the class b/c I lost total interest due to an unreasonably HARD first test (he literally massacred the whole class). If you do end up in his class make sure that you are participative type that likes to go to every class b/c he gives out self-rate sheets were you score urself on how much you participate each day.
Tests are fairly easy. Actually has real-world experience. Really nice guy. Go to class and you'll do well.

second class with this professor.  He teaches very well.  If you take him in the fall, hope that the Georgia bulldogs do well, because his mood will be better.  Projects are relevant, tests are not very difficult, and the work is all real world applicable.
He tells you specific material to study for tests.  Go to class, and you can get an "A".

Great guy. Tends to get off track but doesn't take it all too serious.  Class sounds like it will be tough on first day however fairly easy if you study his handouts.  He does a great job telling you the contents of the exams.
